entry.title: Deep Dive and Experience Sharing into SAP Joule for Developers(J4D)
entry.content:
Disclaimer: This blog is not written by any LLM.

Well, to start with, Joule for Developers, let us understand what it is?

Many people have a misconception that Joule for Developers or J4D is just an ABAP AI capability. But it is much more beyond ABAP. Joule for Developers(J4D) is collective name for the AI-powered design-time capabilities across SAP Build and ABAP

It includes new and existing features enabled by Joule in:

  1. SAP Build Code
  2. SAP Build Apps
  3. SAP Build Process Automation
  4. ABAP in SAP BTP and S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition

These capabilities help developers build faster, code smarter, and automate better. Is that true? I will my honest opinion for some of them.

I have personally worked on SAP Build Apps, SAP Build Code and Joule for Developers, ABAP AI. I started with a lot of ambiguity and finally I made a mark that I could now explain it to our customers and users.

SAP Build Apps allow for generating pages to handle data entities and generate sample data automatically. It means, whenever you integrate any oData service/REST API/SAP BTP Destination, you get an option to automatically create the User Interface and also generate sample data.

SAP Build Code, has evolved through multiple iterations and seems it is still evolving. 

  • Created Fiori element app using Image
  • Created a series of projects with prompts
  • Created test data

With ABAP AI, I could create a report with the suggestions popping up in run time and that too contextually aware code prompts also known to be predictive code completion feature. We called it Ghost Code. But trust me sometimes they are really good too. 

I see the ABAP and CDS unit scripts getting generated in no time. It was good again on this parameter. 

Code explain, well I created small projects, hence feel it is good to have comments. But the true colors will be visible when you look at the repository of thousands lines of code written by someone and you have no clue of what it is. Using your skills you debug the code to understand what each block/function is doing. It is a life saver in this scenario.

SAP Build Code has the GenAI embedded as part of the service itself. There is no explicit step which need to perform other than just subscribing to this service via the Boosters (from the SAP BTP Global Account).

For SAP Build Apps and SAP Build Process Automation, everything under the new SAP Build Offering, will have the GenAI capability turned off by default. Then, how do you turn it on?

  1. Go to your SAP BTP Subaccount and access the SAP Build Apps and SAP Build Process Automation service from the 'Instances and Subscription' option
  2. SAP Build Lobby will openStep 1 - Access SAP Build Lobby

  3. Now go to the 'Control Tower' in the right hand side panel, last option and then click on the 'Generative AI' tile in the top row, right hand side 'Tenant Configuration'Step 2 - Click on Control Tower Option in Left Hand Pane

  4. Switch on the toggle button of Generative AI
    Step 3 - Click on Generative AI tile in the right hand pane

  5. Read the AI Terms and Conditions and scroll to the bottom of the Terms and Conditions to enable the checkbox of 'I have read the terms and conditions' - this is called as 'Scroll wrap agreement' in the language of Law - it means you agree to the Terms and Conditions and read till the last of the agreement.

    Step 5 - Read/Scroll to the end of the AI Terms & Conditions

  6. Click on the checkbox of 'I have read the terms and conditions'  

    Step 6 - Click on 'Accept' button on the right hand bottom corner

  7. Now click on the 'Accept' button 

    Step 4 - Turn on the toggle of Enable Generative AI features

  8. That's it. Now you can explore the GenAI capability inside SAP Build Apps and SAP Build Process Automation.

Some people have questions whether they need to sign a 0 USD AI Terms and Conditions contract to activate the GenAI capability for J4D. The answer is, except for 'Joule for Developers ABAP AI' capability, you do NOT need to sign an explicit contract for AI Terms and Conditions. They are all embedded within the services.

Well this will be an evolving document, where I will keep updating my reviews on each of these services mentioned. Stay tuned!

entry.title: SAP Build Work Zone Security
entry.content:
I've been spending quite some time recently diving deep into SAP Build Work Zone security, and let me tell you, it's a journey. Terms like #IAS, #BTP Subaccount #trusts, and #ShadowUsers can sometimes feel like a maze.

But then, an analogy clicked for me - the #DigitalMall and suddenly, the whole complex architecture started making perfect sense. I wanted to share this breakdown with all of you, hoping it helps.

Let's imagine SAP Build Work Zone as a bustling, modern Digital Mall, where users (you, the #shoppers) come to access various #stores (business applications) and "services" (collaboration features). Every security layer has a purpose, just like every part of a well run mall

#TheGrandOpening: Understanding this Digital Mall's Foundation

Before anyone even walks in, the mall has a master plan and a way to organize its offerings:

>>> SAP BTP Subaccount: Think of this as the Mall's Main Entrance & Security Gate. It's the primary gateway, controlling who can even step foot inside your digital space. It's where core permissions are managed.

>>> SAP Build Work Zone Tenant: This is your specific, unique instance of the Mall itself - your personalized shopping experience!

>>> #ContentManager: This acts like the Mall's Central Directory or Information Kiosk. It lists all the "stores" (your business applications) available within the mall, helping shoppers find what they need

>>> Content Providers: These are the "Department Stores" (like SAP S/4HANA
SuccessFactors) or even smaller "Boutiques" (your custom applications). They reside outside your immediate mall structure but integrate seamlessly, making their offerings available inside your Work Zone.

>>>>Stepping Inside: Your Identity & Basic Mall Access<<<<

Now, for the really crucial part: how does a "shopper" (your user) actually get into the Digital Mall, and how is their identity validated at the main entrance?

>>> #SAPCloudIdentityServices - Identity Authentication (IAS): The Mall's Central Security System / ID Proxy

This is the mandatory first stop for any user trying to enter your Work Zone mall. #IAS is your primary #IdentityProvider [IDP]

>>> #Proxy Mode: If your organization uses its own Corporate IdP (like Azure AD, Okta), IAS acts as a clever proxy. You authenticate against your corporate system, and IAS then receives that verified identity, federating it onward in a way Work Zone understands. It's seamless, you just show your corporate ID.

>>> #TheDigitalIdCard (SAML Assertion / OIDC Token): Once authenticated, IAS issues a secure token. This token is packed with vital information, essentially your digital "ID Card" that gets you past the main gate:

>>> #SubjectNameIdentifier (SNI): This is your main identifier (e.g., your Login Name or Employee ID). It's what the BTP Subaccount primarily uses.

#Assertion Attribute (often IAS UUID): This is a unique, stable, and persistent ID assigned by IAS. It's super important for internal Work Zone component communication later on, especially with the DWS (our "Community Center," which I'll cover in Part 2!)

---> Other standard user attributes like email, first name, last name.

SAP BTP Subaccount Trust Configuration: The Main Gate's Agreement with IAS

Your BTP Subaccount (the main gate) has a "trust agreement" with IAS. This allows it to confidently accept those digital ID cards (tokens) from IAS.

>>> #The XSUAA Shadow User: Your Mall Access Card. This is one of the most critical concepts

When a user successfully authenticates via IAS for the first time, a "Shadow User" record is either created or identified in the BTP Subaccount's internal user list. Think of this as your personal "Mall Access Card" record.

 

Why is it needed? Even if IAS knows who you are, the BTP Subaccount needs its own local record (the shadow user) to attach BTP Role Collections to it. These role collections are your "Mall-wide Privileges" (e.g., WorkZone_User, WorkZone_Admin) that determine what you can do across the whole Work Zone platform.

 

>>>> Crucial Point: If a shadow user doesn't exist (and automatic creation isn't enabled), login to Work Zone will fail because there is no local identity to attach permissions to.

Principal Propagation: Seamless Access to Department Stores!

Once you're in the mall and launch an app from an On-Premise Backend System (like an S/4HANA Fiori app via SAP Cloud Connector), you don't want to log in again, right?

This is where ##Principal Propagation comes in! Your identity (using the IAS SNI from the BTP trust) is seamlessly passed through the BTP Destination Service and SAP Cloud Connector directly to the backend system. The S/ 4HANA system then recognizes you and authorizes your access based on your roles within S/4HANA. It's like your Mall Access Card automatically opening the staff-only doors in a department store.

This is just the exciting first step of understanding Work Zone security. In Part 2, coming next.

The Digital Workplace Service (DWS) (the Mall's Community Center).

User and User List Provisioning (how the Community Center gets its member lists).

The critical differences between Internal vs. External Users (different types of Community Center members).

And how SCIM APIs are the "automated delivery trucks" for all this data!

Stay tuned for more insights, and in the meantime, I'd love to hear your thoughts or questions on this first part in the comments below!

Happy Work Zone-ing!

Lets connect and learn together ✌️

entry.title: Boost your CAP Development with AI: Introducing the MCP Server for CAP
entry.content:
Imagine the following: You are an experienced developer, working on SAP Cloud Application Programming Model (CAP) projects. You use AI agents, such as Claude Code, opencode, or GitHub Copilot, to support you in your daily work. Wouldn't it be cool if the used LLM can help you develop CAP applications? With our new MCP server for CAP, we can provide more context about your project as well as relevant CAP examples to steer the LLM in doing the right thing.

 

What is an MCP Server?

An MCP (Model Context Protocol) server is designed to manage and deliver capabilities to Large Language Models (LLMs) via AI agents. It bridges the gap between LLMs and external resources such as services, tools, and data, enabling LLMs to interact with these resources. The newly introduced MCP server for CAP transforms AI agents into CAP development experts. It provides context-focused tools that aim to help the AI agent to answer questions such as:

  • Which CDS (Core Data Services) services does my project expose and where are they served?
  • What are the entities about and how do they relate to each other?
  • How do I add columns to a select statement in CAP Node.js?
  • How can I register custom READ handlers in CAP Java?

 

The MCP Server for CAP

In the context of the assisted development introduced in the beginning, this means: You might ask the LLM to add, for example, a bound action `setToCompleted` to the entity `Orders`. Without our new MCP server for CAP, the LLM would hallucinate and could invent a new syntax and do a lot of file searches to find the relevant file. With the help of our new MCP server for CAP the LLM behaves as intended. To do so, the LLM generates a tool call to check the Orders entity and relevant information is returned, such as its elements and file location. It also generates a tool call to check the CAP documentation for bound actions. Based on the results, it generates the correct CDS code to add the bound action. This, of course, is just one example. We designed our MCP server for CAP to help you with arbitrary tasks instead of focusing on single commands.

For this purpose, our newly introduced MCP server for CAP provides the following two tools for AI-assisted development of CAP applications:

search_model

This tool allows the AI model to perform a fuzzy search for CDS definitions (entities, services, actions) within a unified compiled CDS model of all your .cds files. This CDS model includes the model structure and relationships, annotations and metadata, and the generated HTTP endpoints.

The fuzzy search algorithm matches definition names and supports partial matches, making it easy to find entities such as "Books" even when searching for "book".

search_docs

This tool enables the AI model to perform a semantic search through the preprocessed  CAP documentation, which is stored locally as embeddings. The search query is converted to an embedding vector. Finally, a similarity search is performed to find the relevant parts of the documentation, which have the highest semantic similarity to your query even if the exact keywords are not used.

Please note: These tools are meant to be used by AI models and do not constitute a stable API. But for experimental purposes, you can also use the tools directly from the command line as documented here: MCP server for AI-assisted development of CAP applications.

 

Try it out

Are you excited to try it out? Detailed instructions can be found here: MCP server for AI-assisted development of CAP applications.

Important: Our MCP Server for CAP is designed to support professional developers in their daily work. As with all AI-generated information, you should check the generated results carefully to avoid unintended side effects.

We are excited to announce that the MCP Server for CAP is an open-source project, licensed under the Apache-2.0 license. Learn more about open source at SAP.

We are very curious to see what you will do with our MCP server for CAP! Please don't hesitate to provide your feedback here or report any issues in our GitHub repository.

 

Beyond CAP

We also offer a UI5 MCP server and an MCP server for SAP Fiori, ensuring that you have a comprehensive suite of tools to enhance your development workflow across various SAP technologies. You can find the packages here: UI5 MCP server and MCP server for SAP Fiori.

The introduction of the MCP servers for CAP, SAPUI5 and SAP Fiori marks a significant step forward in leveraging AI to enhance developer productivity.

Stay tuned for more updates. Happy coding!

entry.title: SAP Build introduces new MCP Servers to enable agentic development for Enterprise Applications
entry.content:
Agentic AI application development is fundamentally reshaping the way business applications are designed, developed, and delivered. AI-powered assistants and copilots are rapidly becoming an integral part of the development process, helping teams to boost productivity, reduce errors, and innovate faster than ever.

Meeting Developers Where They Are

SAP is committed to meeting developers where they’re at – that means no matter where or how you code, you have the freedom to choose the environment that best suits your needs and access to the tools that maximize your productivity and impact.

To that end, I’m excited to share that SAP is introducing Model Context Protocol (MCP) servers to boost development with the following technologies:

  1. Cloud Application Programming Model (CAP)
  2. SAP Fiori Elements 
  3. SAPUI5 

By adopting these new MCP standards, developers can seamlessly extend SAP’s development capabilities into multiple environments, ensuring flexibility and choice. SAP Build now enhances popular IDEs and AI coding assistants such as Cursor, Windsurf, Github Copilot, Cline and Claude Code.

We are also excited to share that the MCP Servers are being released as an open-source projects, licensed under the Apache-2.0 license. This marks another step in our commitment to openness and community-driven innovation. Learn more about Open Source at SAP.

What is an MCP?

MCP is an emerging open standard that allows AI models and tools to interact in a structured, secure, and consistent way. MCP acts as a universal bridge between an AI coding assistant with an LLM and external tools, data, and workflows — so the model can seamlessly fetch context, take actions, and deliver more accurate, useful results. MCP gives developers the ability to integrate their tools with the broader AI ecosystem while receiving the right assistance, at the right time, without switching contexts.

The Value of SAP MCP Tools

While many AI tools generate code, SAP takes this a step further by ensuring that what’s generated provides a solid foundation for building enterprise-grade applications. The MCP tools delivered by SAP are backed by our technology teams and designed specifically for SAP Business Applications. This means:

  • Best Practices Built-In: Generated code with CAP, UI5 and Fiori elements code already provides you with the right starting point for reaching SAP standards and proven design guidelines.
  • Guided Development: Developers receive recommendations and guardrails tailored to SAP Business Technology Platform (BTP).
  • Consistency:  SAP’s MCP tools are and will be reused across our tooling portfolio, ensuring consistent developer experience and outcomes wherever you build SAP applications. Whether you’re generating backend services, UIs, or business logic, you can rely on the same quality, structure, and compliance.

Scaling AI Agents with SAP Expertise

One of the most powerful aspects of MCP adoption is the ability to upscale AI agent chat capabilities with deep SAP application development expertise. This means that AI copilots and agents can go beyond generic code suggestions to provide context-aware, SAP-specific guidance. Whether you are working with Vibe Coding tools on the web or coding directly in your IDE of choice, MCP brings value to everyone — from casual and junior developers to senior professionals. It enables you to build enterprise-grade SAP applications with confidence, while seamlessly combining AI-driven assistance with SAP’s trusted frameworks, best practices, and tooling to maximize productivity.

 

Looking Ahead

These are exciting times to be a developer. The combination of AI and open standards like MCP is rewriting the rules of software development. At SAP, we are committed to keeping our developer community at the forefront of innovation. By investing in AI-powered tools and standards, we ensure that you—our developers—have everything you need to build, scale, and innovate with confidence. 🚀

entry.title: Let’s Talk About Clean Core
entry.content:
What is Clean Core?

In simple terms: Clean Core is the practice of keeping the core of SAP S/4HANA as “clean” and standardized as possible.

This means avoiding heavy customizations directly in the system core and, instead, using extensions, APIs, and official tools provided by SAP. By doing so, your company can:

  • Upgrade the system with less effort.

  • Reduce maintenance costs.

  • Adopt innovations much faster.

👉 More details here: SAP Clean Core Methodology

Why is this important?

In SAP ECC, it was common for companies to change the central code to meet specific needs. The result? A heavy, rigid system — expensive to upgrade and always slowing down the move to the cloud.

Clean Core was born to break this cycle. It allows your company to take advantage of SAP’s continuous updates without the “headaches,” while staying agile enough to innovate.

A Simple Analogy: Tidying Up the House

Think about it like this:

  • If you organize your house the way Marie Kondo suggests — everything in its place — it’s much easier to keep order every day.

  • But if you only tidy up when guests arrive, you’ll spend way more time and energy, and probably still leave things out of place.

Clean Core works the same way: you keep the system organized from the start, instead of “fixing things” only when a new upgrade or version migration arrives.

So, Where Should You Customize?

Here’s the strategic insight: not everything needs customization.

Accounting reports, tax invoices, legal requirements… these are standardized and can follow SAP’s market-ready models, especially in the Cloud Public Edition.

That frees up time and budget for what really matters: the processes that differentiate your business and make customers choose you.

And it’s there — in these unique areas — that you should apply business intelligence and customizations, using the right S/4HANA tools (such as in-app extensions or side-by-side developments on SAP BTP).

In Summary

Clean Core is more than a technical recommendation. It’s a system management philosophy:

  • Keep what is standard truly standard.

  • Customize only where your competitive advantage lies.

  • Always think about why your company exists and the value it delivers to customers.

That way, every update will be smooth, every innovation easier to adopt, and the company’s focus will remain on what creates real market impact.

entry.title: SAP Partners - Fast Track your SAP Business Technology Platform Certification Path
entry.content:
SAP Business Technology Platform Certification Path – From Beginner to Advanced

Are you interested in getting your SAP Business Technology Platform ( SAP BTP)  certification, but unsure of where to begin?

In this blog, we would like to give you a better overview of the available SAP BTP certifications and guide you how to progress from foundational level to professional expertise. Additionally, we will introduce several enablement offerings, specifically designed for SAP Partners,  that can help you fast track your SAP BTP certification. 

Depending on your existing knowledge and skills, you can determine which of the three steps below is the ideal starting point for you.

 

 

 

 

 

 

Step 1- Entry-Level Certification

For partners who are new to SAP’s ecosystem, one of the best starting points to learn the basics of SAP Business Suite and the importance of SAP BTP is the entry level certification “Positioning SAP Business Technology Platform as part of the SAP Business Suite”.

This certification takes you through the foundational courses of the SAP Business Technology Platform, enabling the enhancement of business processes through the integration of intelligent technologies, the development of innovative applications, and the analysis and visualization of data.

  • For SAP Partners, we offer bi-weekly 90 minutes webinars that are led by SAP experts and will provide the clarity, focus, and key insights you need to approach the certification exam with confidence. Access the latest schedule. 

 

Step 2- Get Specialized with the Associate Level Certifications

 If you already have the foundational knowledge in SAP BTP, you can delve into specialized certification tracks based on their career goals and interests. Professionals choose from distinct areas, including Application Development and Automation, Integration Database and Data Management, and AI Foundation. Each specialization offers focused certifications and provide the skills required to address specific business needs and technical challenges, equipping learners with the knowledge to advance their SAP careers.

For SAP Partners , you can join one of the Partner Get and Stay Certified Academies below that will help you with the certification exam. 

  • Partner Get Certified Academy for Security Administrator
  • Partner Get Certified Academy for Backend Developer – CAP
  • Partner Get Certified Academy for SAP Build – LCNC
  • Partner Get Certified Academy for Integration Developer
  • Partner Get Certified Academy for Backend Developer – ABAP Cloud

 

Step 3 - Become a SAP BTP Solution Architect

Experienced professionals can pursue the SAP BTP Solution Architect professional certification. From a career development perspective, this certification is marking the transition from a specialized skillset to a broader, strategic role. Solution architects are responsible for designing comprehensive SAP BTP implementations that align with business objectives and technical requirements.

  • For SAP Partners - Access Partner Get Certified Academy for SAP BTP Solution Architect

entry.title: SAP Developer News September 4th, 2025
entry.content:
DESCRIPTION

PODCAST: https://podcast.opensap.info/sap-developers/2025/09/04/sap-developer-news-september-4th-2025/↗

SAP Build introduces new MCP Servers

  • SAP Build introduces new MCP Servers to enable agentic development for Enterprise Applications: https://community.sap.com/t5/technology-blog-posts-by-sap/sap-build-introduces-new-mcp-servers-to-enable-agentic-development-for/ba-p/14205602
  • Introducing the MCP Server for CAP: https://community.sap.com/t5/technology-blog-posts-by-sap/boost-your-cap-development-with-ai-introducing-the-mcp-server-for-cap/ba-p/14202849
  • First Release of the SAP Fiori MCP Server for Agentic AI Workflows: https://community.sap.com/t5/technology-blog-posts-by-sap/sap-fiori-tools-update-first-release-of-the-sap-fiori-mcp-server-for/ba-p/14204694
  • Introducing the UI5 MCP Server: https://community.sap.com/t5/technology-blog-posts-by-sap/give-your-ai-agent-some-tools-introducing-the-ui5-mcp-server/ba-p/14200825
  • AI agents talk at SIT Porto: https://www.linkedin.com/feed/update/urn:li:activity:7358844307413393408/

ABAP Partner Reference Application

  • ABAP Partner Reference Application: https://github.com/SAP-samples/abap-partner-reference-application?tab=readme-ov-file

Step-by-step guidance to extend Joule via Joule Studio in SAP Build (Live Session)

  • Step-by-step guidance to extend Joule via Joule Studio in SAP Build (Live Session): https://learning.sap.com/live-sessions/step-by-step-guidance-to-extend-joule-via-joule-studio-in-sap-build

 

CHAPTER TITLES

0:00 Intro

0:10 SAP Build introduces new MCP Servers

2:28 Step-by-step guidance to extend Joule via Joule Studio in SAP Build (Live Session)

3:06 ABAP Partner Reference Application

 

TRANSCRIPTION

[Intro] This is the SAP Developer News for September 4th, 2025.

[Witalij] If you see me wearing this T-shirt, you can be sure it's about AI. And you are absolutely right. This announcement has been wildly shared this week, but in case you missed it, we at SAP have introduced MCP servers to bring the Model Context Protocol into enterprise application development. The emerging open standard Mobile Context Protocol defines how large-language models can access tools and project context in a secure and structured way. Three servers are now available. For the Cloud Application Programming Model, for SAP Fiori Elements, and for SAPUI5. Let's double-click on each of them. The CAPMCP server has been released as open source under the Apache 2.0 license. It provides two tools for AI-assisted development of CAP applications, one to search across the compiled CDS model and one to search the CAP documentation. The Fiori MCP server lets AI agents generate and edit Fiori applications, discover apps in the workspace, and follow built-in rules that enforce best practices. This speeds up prototyping and makes iterations easier. The server is actually available as an experimental release. The UI5 MCP server equips your AI agents with six tools. This range from best practice guidelines and product scaffolding to searching the API reference, linking code and fixing deprecated APIs, providing insights into the project details. By releasing the CUP server as open source and extending MCP to Fiori and UI5, we are building an ecosystem where AI agents can actively support enterprise development. To learn more, we invite you to explore the CAP MCP server on GitHub, try out the UI5 and Fiori Elements servers in your own projects, and share your feedback on SAP community. And be sure to follow upcoming updates in SAP Build Code to see how Joule continues to expand MCP-based scenarios. By the way, if you are interested in AI agents, this month I will be presenting this very topic at SAP Meetup in Luz, in Poland, and at SAP Insight Track in Porto, Portugal. See you then.

[Nora] I have some great news for our listeners with a Learning Hub subscription, because the AI advocacy team is hosting a live session called Step-by-Step Guidance to Extend Joule by Joule Studio in SAP Build. It's going to take place on the 16th of September at 11 Central European Summertime, 11 a.m. It's targeted at developers. It's going to be a hands-on session that will teach you everything you need to know about Joule Studio, how to build your custom skills, how to integrate it into other systems, and how to test and deploy your skill. And it's targeted at beginners. So make sure you sign up and learn from the experts themselves.

[M K, Sheena] By leveraging the SAP BTP ABAP environment and the ABAP RESTful Application Programming model, you can build applications side-by-side to SAP solutions such as SAP S/4HANA Cloud. This GitHub repository provides a sample partner reference application called Music Festival Manager to build, deploy, and run side-by-side multi-tenant applications based on the SAP EVTP APAC Cloud to extend and integrate with SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud. These applications ensure SAP standards for enterprise-grade business solutions and also offers a consistent, harmonized user experience. The advantages include a clean code for a page safety, a scalable cloud development model, and secure integration with SAP S/4HANA Cloud. In addition to the step-by-step tutorial, it also includes sizing guides, build materials, best practices, and tools for building multi-tenant extensions. Check out the GitHub repository link in the description box below and start building your enterprise create SaaS applications today.

entry.title: CDS Views: The Key to a "Clean Core" and a More Agile SAP
entry.content:
What is a CDS View?

In SAP S/4HANA, a CDS View (Core Data Services) is the modern way to create an intelligent, semantic data layer directly on the SAP HANA database. Think of it as a "super-advanced filter" or a virtual report that organizes and makes information from various tables available in a consistent, standardized, and reusable way.

  • It's a method to centralize and standardize data access, eliminating the need for repetitive and complex code for queries.

  • It serves as a single source of truth, allowing Fiori apps, analytical reports, APIs, and even external integrations to consume the same data consistently.

An Analogy:

Imagine you have a stack of information in different spreadsheets. Instead of manually joining, copying, and pasting data to create a report, you build a CDS View.

This CDS View is a "virtual report" you create just once. In it, you define exactly what data you need from which spreadsheets (tables), how they connect, and how they should be presented (for example, "this column represents a monetary value").

Why are CDS Views Essential in S/4HANA?

  • Unmatched Performance: A CDS View processes data where it lives—on the database, the "filing room." Instead of moving large volumes of data to the "office" (application server), all the logic is executed locally, which is incredibly faster, especially with the power of SAP HANA.

  • Versatility and Reusability: Once you create a CDS View, you can use it for various purposes without replicating your work. The same data view can be used to:

    • Create an analytical chart on a dashboard.

    • Build a mobile app (Fiori).

    • Generate a detailed report for management.

  • Built-in Intelligence: A CDS View goes far beyond just displaying data. It is "intelligent" by nature. Within it, you can embed business rules, such as "show only sales from the last quarter" or "restrict salary viewing to managers only."

The Context: SAP's Evolution to S/4HANA

The creation of CDS Views is directly tied to the evolution of SAP's technology. Before the arrival of SAP HANA, the architecture was traditional: ABAP programs ran on an application server, and data resided on a separate database server.

For any analysis or report, large volumes of data had to be transferred from the database to the application server. This back-and-forth was slow and inefficient, creating a performance bottleneck.

With HANA, everything changed. As an in-memory database, it processes data at extremely high speeds. SAP then adopted the "Code-to-Data" (or "Code Pushdown") philosophy—that is, "pushing" the processing logic to where the data already is: on the database itself.

This is where the CDS View finds its purpose:

  • Overcoming the Past: Old database views were simple and static. CDS Views were created to be an intelligent new data modeling layer that leverages all the capabilities of HANA, such as parallel processing and real-time analytics.

  • Centralizing Logic: They allow developers to define business logic (calculations, filters, aggregations) and access rules directly in the view, centralizing technical knowledge in a single location.

  • Preparing for the Future: CDS Views were SAP's solution to support the new SAP Fiori interface and embedded analytics tools. With semantic annotations, they make it easy to create modern, intuitive applications that understand the meaning of the data.

The Connection to the "Clean Core" Strategy

The CDS View is the central tool that SAP provides to put the Clean Core strategy into practice. The goal of the Clean Core is to keep the S/4HANA system as close as possible to its standard version, avoiding direct modifications to its "core."

Traditionally, companies altered standard code and tables, making future upgrades and innovations very expensive and complex.

CDS Views changed the game. Instead of modifying what already exists, developers create CDS Views to meet specific needs.

  • Extensions Without Complications: Instead of modifying a standard SAP table, you create an extension CDS View, adding fields or logic without touching the original object.

  • Abstraction and Protection: CDS Views act as an abstraction layer. Your application only communicates with the view, not with the standard table. This means that if the underlying table structure changes in a future upgrade, your application won't be affected because the CDS View can be adjusted to absorb the change.

  • Smoother Upgrades: Because customizations are in separate objects (the CDS Views), the process of upgrading to a new S/4HANA version becomes much safer and faster, without the risk of code conflicts.

  • Centralized Consistency: By centralizing business logic in CDS Views, you prevent code duplication and ensure that rules are applied consistently throughout the system.

The Clean Core is a strategy that aims to keep the SAP S/4HANA system as close as possible to its original standard. Historically, companies customized SAP by altering core tables and programs, which made upgrades complex, slow, and expensive.

CDS Views emerged as the ideal tool to solve this problem. They allow you to add your business logic and customizations without modifying SAP's standard code.

Usefull Links:

https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_S4HANA_CLOUD/c0c54048d35849128be8e872df5bea6d/5418de55938d1d22e10000000a44147b.html

https://community.sap.com/t5/technology-blog-posts-by-members/code-to-data-paradigm-in-abap-with-sap-hana/ba-p/13428352

entry.title: SAP BTP for HR at SAP Connect and Success Connect 2025 summary - bigger and better than ever
entry.content:
Come see SAP Business Technology Platform (BTP) at this year’s SAP Connect / Success Connect event in Las Vegas! Due to the ever-increasing interest in SAP BTP topics and our sessions in prior years having standing-room only attendance, SAP BTP has more sessions than ever before! We even have for the first time ever, not one, but two hands-on-labs!

Related: For more information about SAP BTP presence outside of HCM, see these two articles:

  • Success Connect: Your People Deserve More Than Just Software - They Deserve Success - SAP Community
  • SAP Connect 2025: The Ultimate Business Transformation Experience - SAP Community

 

SAP BTP topics for 2025

This year’s SAP BTP for HR experience at SAP Connect is all about more. More business scenarios, more technology, more platform - more BTP! This year’s topics include customer favorites such as integration, extensibility and automation as well as numerous SAP SuccessFactors product-led sessions about how SAP BTP helps them deliver better solutions making it easier for customers to streamline HCM processes. Additionally, as we see an increase in technical audience members, we’ll be featuring slightly more
technical product deep dives by the product teams (also a first for us!).

Demos and hands-on labs

Demo-station demo: Automate new hire equipment ordering during onboarding, featuring Integration Suite Advanced Event Mesh

We’re showcasing two demos at the “Integration and Extension with SAP BTP” demo station. The first is our popular Automate new hire equipment ordering during onboarding demo which shows SAP Integration Suite’s Advanced Event Mesh event-driven integration capabilities to provide automated equipment ordering. This dramatically reduces the amount of time a people manager spends ordering equipment as well as requesting access to systems and data. If you missed this demo in Lisbon last year, then this is your chance!  Included are:

  • See how we used SAP Signavio Process Intelligence to analyze onboarding processes to identify key areas to address inefficiencies: hiring manager ordering of equipment, waiting for responses from people via email
  • SAP Integration Suite and advanced event mesh which offers real-time triggering of data synchronization based on SAP SuccessFactors Employee Central event triggers
  • An example app an IT department can create to offer pre-bundled packages of equipment to make it easier for managers to pick equipment, and to standardize offerings
  • One-click approvals by the hiring manager, powered by SAP Build 
  • Automatically submitting equipment selection to SAP Ariba guided buying via SAP Integration Suite
  • Notifications pushed to the task center for the hiring manager via SAP Build
  • Automatic submission of support tickets to SAP Service Cloud for manual tasks like requesting access to systems and data


Demo-station demo: Create a mobile app with SAP Build demo and hands-on lab

Additionally, we’re showing our brand new Create a mobile app with SAP Build demo which is specifically designed for more technical HRIS audiences in collaboration with the SAP SuccessFactors team. 

This demo is also the basis of two, 75-minute hands-on labs we’re offering this year which are sure to sell out! The lab will walk non-technical novices and intermediate technical knowledge people (non-developers, IT and HRIS are our target audience) on how to use SAP Build to quickly and easily create a mobile app with SAP SuccessFactors Employee Central people data to offer location-specific benefits for a field office – all with no coding, using SAP Build’s powerful drag-and-drop development interface. We’ll have product experts from the SAP Build team presenting and explaining to the audience the different capabilities of SAP Build in a follow-the-presenter format from their own workstations in live SAP Build environments so everyone will be able to walk away with direct product knowledge of what’s possible.
Included in the session:

  • Overview of the low-code SAP Build environment
  • Overview of various content types, controls, functions available
  • Adding content and configuring to the controls
  • Using an integration to SAP SuccessFactors Employee Central for people data
  • Accessing benefits information in the employee profile via API
  • Customizing the look and feel of the app
  • Testing the app and deployment

View the hands-on lab in the event catalog: Hands-on lab: Creating a custom mobile app for HR using SAP Build solutions (limited capacity) | HCM1677

There’s also quick overview videos of both these demos on the SAP.com/btp-for-HR page as well!

 

SAP BTP-led sessions

Integration sessions


Maximizing HCM process efficiency with integration through SAP BTP | HCM1665

Discover how SAP Business Technology Platform and SAP Integration Suite enable integrations for SAP SuccessFactors HCM, automating tasks and processes. Explore third-party integration use cases, such as recruiting, onboarding, and data collection, and strategies for connecting hybrid landscapes, including legacy on-premises and third-party systems as well as event-driven integrations.

How to use event-driven integration to collaborate in real time | HCM1682

Explore how SAP Integration Suite advanced event mesh can use business events from SAP SuccessFactors solutions such as SAP SuccessFactors Employee Central to push data to other internal or external systems in real-time. See firsthand how you can use this capability to trigger immediate actions, such as when an employee is hired or terminated.



Application development and extensibility sessions

Increasing employee efficiency with automation capabilities in SAP BTP | HCM1671

Explore automation capabilities in SAP Business Technology Platform (SAP BTP) that can streamline your HCM processes. From recruiting and onboarding to document management, SAP BTP can help you reduce errors in manual data entry and make your employees happier by reducing repetitive and mundane tasks through automation and workflows.

Using SAP Build to extend your SAP SuccessFactors solutions | HCM1463

Standardized business processes have come a long way, but every company still has a few things it does differently from everybody else. SAP Build solutions can help extend your human capital management solutions to address your specific business needs. See firsthand how to create low-code/no-code apps that boost end-user adoption and efficiency.

 

SAP SuccessFactors-led technology sessions including SAP BTP


These SAP SuccessFactors product expert-led sessions discuss how SAP BTP solutions help SAP SuccessFactors deliver better solutions to our customers as well as ways customers may not be aware of how they can use SAP BTP today with their existing SAP SuccessFactors solutions.

 

AI Technology, use cases and innovation

Road map and vision: AI in SAP SuccessFactors HCM | HCM1451

Look at SAP’s AI strategy and planned AI innovations in SAP SuccessFactors HCM. See what’s on the AI road map for HCM and get insights into SAP’s responsible, real-world AI approach. AI-driven capabilities such as the Joule copilot, AI agents, and the mobile experience with Joule  enhance employee experience, adaptability, and productivity

Unlocking and extending the Joule copilot with Joule Studio | HCM1571

Experience how Joule Studio allows you to create and deploy custom Joule agents and skills that improve efficiency across SAP and third-party systems and enhance your HR experience. Learn about prerequisites and how to get started, and find out how the agent builder capability in Joule Studio can empower you to create your own intelligent agents.

Everything you need to know about AI agents for HCM | HCM1468

AI agents are "smart teammates" that can observe, plan, and act, often without human intervention. Get a first look at some of the Joule Agents in the HCM road map, such as those for performance and goals, HR service, and people intelligence. Learn how agents can automate complex workflows, augment human capabilities, and drive efficiency.

 

 

Employee experience via integration and extensibility

Drive productivity by integrating and extending your HCM solutions | HCM1081

Discover how our recent innovations around integration and extension can help transform your business operations and enhance the user experience. You can use these technologies to integrate and extend your SAP SuccessFactors HCM portfolio with SAP Business Technology Platform.

Enhancing people profiles with SAP Business Technology Platform | HCM1520

See firsthand how you can enhance the latest people profile using SAP Business Technology Platform (SAP BTP), with an exclusive preview of advanced features slated for early adopter release in the second half of 2025. Learn how to extend people profiles to meet your organization’s needs and boost the user experience.

 

 

Technology and administration


Road map and vision: Application and technology foundation | HCM1030

Explore the latest innovations and enhancements in the technology and application foundation of SAP SuccessFactors solutions, including the SAP Business Data Cloud solution, Joule Studio, security, integration, extensibility through SAP Build solutions, and more. See demos and gain insights into what we have planned for our upcoming releases.

Simplifying your system administration to maximize business continuity | HCM1106

Explore innovative solutions to streamline system configuration and administration of your SAP SuccessFactors solutions. Gain practical tips on how your organization can modernize infrastructure management and boost efficiency with powerful administrative capabilities.

Fortifying together: Best practices for partner and customer security | HCM1061

Explore collaboration strategies and best practices for bolstering security across partners and customers. Discover how collective efforts and aligned practices can mitigate risks and build resilient ecosystems. Don't miss this opportunity to strengthen your security framework and foster trust among your business network.

 

If you haven’t attended Success Connect in the past (now SAP Connect), this year is the time to come to see all the great BTP content and sessions! Learn more about SAP Connect on the event page.

entry.title: 🚀 SAP BTP Weekly: Practical AI, Enhanced Analytics, and a Vision for the Future
entry.content:
1. Joule Studio and No-Code AI Agents
Creating intelligent agents without coding is now possible in SAP Build. This opens the door for both business and IT teams to build copilots that answer questions and automate tasks quickly.

Beyond the no-code hype, the challenge is cultural: will users trust an internally developed agent? Imagine a procurement team building an agent to negotiate with suppliers—it speeds up the process, but what if the agent misinterprets company policies? Human oversight remains essential.

🔗 https://www.sap.com/spain/products/artificial-intelligence/joule-studio.html 

2. Joule for Consultants
A new program helps SAP consultants use Joule as a copilot during implementations. It includes guides, templates, and real-world use cases that can be applied directly to client projects.

The potential lies in reducing configuration time and accelerating deployments. But it also raises questions: to what extent will Joule replace manual tasks? For example, in a SuccessFactors project, it could generate initial configurations within minutes—though expert validation will always be required.

🔗 https://www.sap.com/spain/products/artificial-intelligence/ai-assistant/sap-consulting-capability.html 

3. Integration with Event Mesh and Kafka
SAP Advanced Event Mesh now connects with Apache Kafka, enabling hybrid and decentralized architectures. This allows for more resilient micro-integrations compared to traditional point-to-point models.

The practical challenge lies in governance. A retail company might use it to synchronize inventories across multiple channels in seconds, but managing topics and ensuring traceability can become complex. SAP provides connectors, but the learning curve is real.

🔗 https://events.sap.com/eur-expertsession-aemkafka/en_us/home.html 

4. Real-World FinOps on BTP
Companies adopting FinOps on BTP are gaining visibility and achieving up to 20% reductions in cloud costs. Dashboards and alerts help CIOs and CFOs make faster decisions.

The challenge is organizational: finance and IT often “speak different languages.” Imagine a telco optimizing Integration Suite consumption—without internal agreements, discussions about who pays what can escalate. The technology is ready, governance isn’t always.

🔗 https://community.sap.com/t5/technology-blog-posts-by-sap/enhanced-finops-capabilities-for-sap-btp/ba-p/14113797 

5. SAP Build Process Automation
New preconfigured processes allow automation of HR, compliance, and finance tasks in days. A “shortcut” for organizations seeking efficiency without large-scale projects.

The tricky part is resistance to change. An HR team may see value in automating vacation approvals, but users often fear losing control. SAP provides ready-to-use processes, but tailoring them to each organization still requires effort.

🔗 https://community.sap.com/t5/technology-blog-posts-by-sap/public-site-for-sap-build-pre-built-content/ba-p/13562272 

6. BDC and Databricks: Next-Generation Analytics
The integration between SAP BTP Data & Analytics (BDC) and Databricks enables unification of SAP and non-SAP data in lakehouse environments for AI and advanced analytics.

Picture a mining company combining SAP financial data with IoT sensor data in Databricks: the predictive potential is enormous. The challenge lies in governance: without a clear model, “data democratization” can turn into chaos. SAP ensures traceability, but governance is each organization’s responsibility.

🔗 https://news.sap.com/2025/02/sap-databricks-open-bold-new-era-data-ai/ 

7. SAP Now Argentina – Business Highlights
The event showcased how local companies are applying SAP BTP and Joule to real business processes. Applied AI was the highlight, with use cases in retail, energy, and manufacturing.

Beyond the excitement, scalability remains a question. Can a successful pilot in one area be extended across the entire organization? Use cases inspire, but customers still need clarity on timelines and adoption costs.

🔗 https://www.sap.com/products/data-cloud/databricks.html 

8. SAP Customer Success Day – Our Experience
This week we had the privilege of meeting with over 20 customers in an exclusive workshop on enterprise integration, exploring the power of SAP BTP Advanced Event Mesh (AEM) and SAP Integration Suite.

Beyond the technology, what stood out was how different customers face similar challenges: shifting from point-to-point to event-driven models without losing control or simplicity. A bank raised the need to process thousands of transactions in real time; a retail company sought to orchestrate omnichannel inventory. Everyone agreed the key is not just the tool, but the ability to redesign processes.

🔗 https://www.linkedin.com/feed/update/urn:li:activity:7369726725749903369/ 

At the end of the day, BTP is experienced differently depending on the role: for a CIO it’s efficiency and control, for an architect it’s integration, for a Basis administrator it’s security, and for a consultant it’s delivery speed. Yet ultimately, we all face the same question: how do we create real business value from technology without getting lost in complexity?

entry.title: SAP Connect 2025: The Ultimate Business Transformation Experience
entry.content:
Hello, SAP Community!

I'm thrilled to introduce you to something completely new in the SAP events landscape: SAP Connect 2025, our groundbreaking annual event for business leaders that highlights how businesses maximize their SAP investments and accelerate transformation.

You've invested significantly in SAP solutions across your organization. Your CHRO relies on SAP SuccessFactors for talent management, your CPO uses SAP Ariba to optimize procurement, your CMO leverages SAP Customer Experience solutions to drive engagement, your CFO depends on SAP S/4 Finance to keep the business running, and your COO manages supply chain demand with SAP Integrated Business Planning. But here's the challenge every C-suite leader faces—how do you connect your organization’s disconnected landscape so you can move beyond implementation to true business transformation?

 

 

Beyond Software: Your Partner in Business Success

While SAP is fundamentally a software company, our mission extends far beyond delivering technology. We empower business leaders, whether you're a CHRO building world-class teams, a CPO driving procurement excellence, a CMO creating customer loyalty, a CFO optimizing financial performance, or a COO ensuring operational excellence, to achieve transformational business outcomes.

The reality is that technology alone cannot be the sole factor in innovation. It's the strategic implementation and utilization of that technology that is aligned with your specific business challenges and opportunities that creates measurable value. SAP Connect 2025 is designed around this fundamental truth:

Your business outcomes are our primary measure of achievement.

 

 

The Reality Check: Where Most Organizations Stand Today

The 2025 C-Suite survey by Thomson Reuters Institute identified the following as the key challenges that currently hinder the effectiveness of enabling functions within organizations:

  1. Ineffective data and information flows between different departments
  2. Time-consuming compliance and reporting tasks
  3. Staffing and resourcing challenges, and
  4. Poor data quality and structure.

 

Do any of them sound familiar? Regardless of your role and vertical, these challenges continue to be roadblocks to achieving short- and long-term success for today’s businesses.

 

 

What Makes SAP Connect Different: Connect Everything, Achieve Anything

If you’re a seasoned business leader with SAP events, you’ll notice that it’s looking a little different this year. Unlike the previous years of offering separate events for each department, SAP Connect is now one unified event with five specialized experiences, each designed for a specific department. This clearly illustrates the connection between SAP Business Suite and how these solutions work together to drive enterprise-wide value.

  • Success Connect: Transform your workforce with the latest HR solutions | Register
  • Spend Connect: Optimize business and realize opportunities  | Register
  • Customer Experience Connect: Drive customer loyalty and build relationships  | Register
  • Finance Connect: Revolutionize financial operations to beat market volatility  | Register
  • Supply Chain Connect: Build resilient, intelligent supply chain networks | Register

Each Connect event delivers deep, dedicated content while maintaining a connection to the broader SAP Business Suite ecosystem. You'll walk away with concrete strategies tailored to your specific business challenges.

 

 

How does the SAP Business Technology Platform fit in SAP Connect?

It couldn’t be more fitting! Like this year’s theme of ‘Connect everything. Achieve anything’, SAP Integration Suite within SAP Business Technology Platform is the answer to cross-organization connectivity. Integrating your across SAP and third-party applications allows you to build, extend and automate with SAP Build￼more to bring value to the business. Also, with prebuilt integration packages and AI-assisted features, the ROI can be achieved more efficiently. And of course, we can't forget about AI! With SAP Joule tailored for your developers' needs, you can generate code, automate processes, design intuitive UIs, and build custom agents using AI. 

Take these verified SAP BTP use cases as an example:

 

  1. Create a custom mobile app for HR using SAP Build: 

    1. Business challenge: Complex processes and access to business applications for field-based and deskless employees. Error-prone processes with little visibility into data and insights
    2. Business values: Reduced implementation time with low-code development tools. Improved employee efficiency by streamlining and automating processes
    3. Customer example: CITIC Pacific Mining Management Pty Ltd. integrated SAP SuccessFactors applications, then used SAP Build to automate document digitization in a safe and compliant way via their mobile web app. This eliminated manual information collection, entry, and validation, keeping the data always up-to-date and compliant. This allowed CITIC to save up to $A300,000 annually on worker productivity.

  2. Expedite your financial close with intelligent automation:

    1. Business challenge: Reliance on error-prone e-mail and spreadsheet tasks for financial closing, paired with time-consuming repetitive tasks.
    2. Business values: Automated tasks with SAP-curated agents and document task completion that decreases errors and strengthens data validation and verification.
    3. Customer example: De Agostini Publishing achieved significant automation improvements in its vendor invoice processing. Over 91% of PO-referred invoices are now processed automatically, and approximately 500 hours are saved per month through its SAP-based solution. The company successfully processes 54,000 paper-based vendor invoices annually while achieving 90-95% text capture accuracy from PDF invoices.

If you're interested, check out the full list of our verified SAP BTP use cases here.

 

 

What's Coming Next in This Series

In the next blog posts, I’ll explore the five Connect experiences and highlight some of the sessions while providing a strategic framework for maximizing your SAP Connect experience and translating insights into business value. But don’t let that stop you from registering and checking out the event agenda to see all the sessions offered at Connect here!

Here’s also a blog from my colleague @rnoia  on SAP BTP for HR at SAP Connect and Success Connect 2025 summary.

Stay tuned for Part 2!

entry.title: Goodbye UI5 Tooling - Hello UI5 CLI!
entry.content:
Over the last decade, UI5 Tooling became the best-in-class tool to develop UI5 projects. It offers a range of features to make your life as a developer easy when serving and building projects using the powerful UI5 framework. In this blogpost, I'll explain the reasons behind the renaming of "UI5 Tooling" to "UI5 CLI".

 

History 

In 2018, when we released the initial version of UI5 Tooling, we used the rather technical-sounding term "UI5 Build and Development Tooling". Already in 2018, we had several discussions about which name would fit best for the project and at that point in time we came up with the shortened term "UI5 Tooling".  

Right from the beginning, we've designed UI5 Tooling modular and extensible, which led to a large and highly engaged community offering various extensions. It's amazing to see how many builder tasks and server middlewares are developed and maintained by the UI5 community. The UI5 community plays a crucial role in the whole UI5 ecosystem. Currently, UI5 Tooling comprises six packages, namely @ui5/cli, @ui5/server, @ui5/builder, @ui5/project, @ui5/fs and @ui5/logger. Despite this modularization, most developers only use@ui5/cli, which includes all the other packages. As you might notice, there is no package name including the term "tooling". This led to the situation that many developers talk about "UI5 CLI" when in fact talking about UI5 Tooling. So we're having two terms for the same project, which is not ideal.  

In 2019, the first version of SAP Fiori tools was released. SAP Fiori tools is a project developed by SAP and offering a wide range of tools to develop SAP Fiori applications more efficiently. It's not only focusing on UI5 but also on further aspects, such as e.g. SAP Fiori elements. SAP Fiori tools contains UI5 Tooling and puts additional functionality on top. If you develop an SAP Fiori application, SAP Fiori tools is the right choice for you. In the meantime, some modules of SAP Fiori tools have also been open-sourced. In 2019, SAP Fiori Tools decided to choose "@sap/ux-ui5-tooling" as its package name, which highlights perfectly the close relationship to the underlying UI5 Tooling project. However, these similar names led to a lot of confusion in the SAP customer and open-source community base. There is no "@ui5/tooling" package on npmjs.org but a package called "@sap/ux-ui5-tooling", which is not UI5 Tooling but actually SAP Fiori tools. That's confusing.  

 

Motivation 

Over the last years, it turned out that keeping the term UI5 Tooling led to much confusion on the consumer side, which then resulted in an increasing support effort on our side. So, we made up our minds over several iterations about what would be the best new name for our tool. Finally, we settled on the term UI5 CLI as our successor term for UI5 Tooling.

 

Good to know 

First, and very importantly, this rename does not affect / disrupt your coding. The packages published on npmjs.org won't change their names.  

Over the next weeks, we'll migrate https://github.com/SAP/ui5-tooling to its new home on the newly created UI5 GitHub organization, and we'll ensure that any old links will be redirected to the new location. As soon as the new repository is available, we recommend updating your bookmarks. We'll use this new repository as a monorepo containing all UI5 CLI-related projects. The other UI5 CLI-related repositories will stay on the SAP GitHub organization and hold the source code for Version 4 and prior releases. The new monorepo will contain the source code for the next major version, for which we'll start the development phase soon, as well as the documentation for all UI5 CLI releases. 

There are already plenty of new features planned for UI5 CLI and we're looking forward to giving you an update on them soon. 

Note: We'll add the URLs of the new repository landscape here as soon as they're available.

entry.title: Success Connect: Your People Deserve More Than Just Software - They Deserve Success
entry.content:
Hello, SAP Community!

From Chief Human Resources Officers to HRIS managers to frontline people leaders, HR professionals at every level are navigating an increasingly complex talent landscape. The pressure to create exceptional employee experiences while driving measurable business outcomes has never been greater. Your organization's success depends not just on having the right technology, but on strategically leveraging that technology to transform how you attract, develop, and retain talent. SAP Business Technology Platform and the SAP SuccessFactors HCM Suite work together to help you achieve exactly that.

For Part 2 of this blog series on SAP Connect 2025, I'm excited to spotlight Success Connect 2025. It will provide CHROs with the next steps to focus on strategic workforce transformation, while delivering deep technical content for HRIS managers and HR technology professionals who implement and optimize these solutions daily.

If this is the first time you're hearing about SAP Connect 2025, read this blog first.

 

 

HR Going Beyond Traditional Boundaries

Today's HR leaders face unprecedented challenges. Regardless of your industry or organization size, you're expected to be data scientists, morale builders, strategic business partners, and technology innovators—all while maintaining the employee experience that defines great HR. On top of that, HR leaders are also faced with major obstacles in preparing their workforce for AI. With all these rapid changes in technology, the workforce’s generational differences, and your organization’s moving goals, where do you go from here?

 

By integrating, extending, and automating your SAP SuccessFactors solutions and processes, SAP Business Technology Platform doesn't just support your organization—it evolves it into what it was meant to be. This enables your existing HR processes to transform into the proactive talent strategy that drives measurable business value. Check out  SAP.com/btp-for-HR page for more in-depth information on how SAP BTP helps deliver better and more efficient HCM processes.

Here are my five must-attend sessions at Success Connect that will expand how you think about HR technology possibilities:

 

 

Your must-attend sessions at Success Connect

 

Scenario 1: Integration

 

Your Challenge: HR processes span multiple systems— the SAP SuccessFactors HCM suite and third-party applications —creating fragmentation that leads to inefficiencies, data errors, and poor employee experiences. Read about the related use case here. 

The Solution: Discover how SAP Integration Suite enables seamless connections between SAP SuccessFactors HCM Suite and your entire HR ecosystem. Explore integration use cases for recruiting, onboarding, and data collection, plus strategies for connecting hybrid landscapes with legacy on-premises systems. See how SAP Integration Suite, Advanced Event Mesh enables you to monitor your event-driven system and manage various aspects of your event-driven architecture. Learn to automate immediate responses for hiring, role changes, and other critical workforce events.

Business Impact: Interconnected HR processes eliminate manual data entry, reduce the time needed to onboard new employees by 50%, and create consistent employee experiences regardless of underlying system complexity. Event-driven integration ensures new employees have system access on day one, eliminates security risks from delayed termination processing, and creates seamless workforce transitions.

If this is you, these sessions should be on your agenda:

 

Maximizing HCM Process Efficiency with Integration Through SAP BTP | HCM1665

Tuesday Oct 7 | 11:15 AM – 12:00 PM PDT

How to Use Event-Driven Integration to Collaborate in Real Time | HCM1682

 Wednesday Oct 8 | 12:30 PM – 12:50 PM PDT

 

 

Scenario 2: Automation

 

Your Challenge: Your employees and HR teams spend valuable time on repetitive tasks, such as managing employee data and records, handling routine processes and more, instead of focusing on strategic HR activities that drive employee engagement and retention. Read about the related use case here. 

The Solution: Explore automation capabilities that streamline recruiting, onboarding, document management, and HR workflows. Learn how SAP BTP helps reduce manual errors while freeing your team to focus on high-value activities that directly impact employee experience.

Business Impact: HR process automation typically reduces administrative overhead by 60% while improving accuracy and employee satisfaction with HR services.

If this is you, this session should be on your agenda:

 

Increasing Employee Efficiency with Automation Capabilities in SAP BTP | HCM1671

 Wednesday Oct 8 | 10:00 AM – 10:45 AM PDT

 

 

Scenario 3: Extensibility and app Development

 

Your Challenge: Your workforce needs mobile access to different HR services, but standard solutions don't address your unique requirements or user experience preferences. The existing processes are prone to errors, making it hard to gain insights from the data. Read about the full use case here. 

The Solution: Explore building a custom mobile app using SAP Build solutions. These solutions make developing an application tailored to your workforce needs intuitive, even for non-technical users. 

Business Impact: With SAP Build's low-code capabilities, a customized application can be built 10 times faster. 

If this is you, this session should be on your agenda:

 

Hands-On Lab: Creating a Custom Mobile App for HR Using SAP Build Solutions | HCM1677

  • Tuesday Oct 7 | 3:30 PM – 4:45 PM PDT
  • Wednesday Oct 8 | 1:00 PM – 2:15 PM PDT

Additionally, a simplified version of the hands-on lab topic of creating a mobile app is being demonstrated at the Integrate and Extend with SAP BTP demo station in the HCM area, when the show floor is open

Enhancing People Profiles with SAP Business Technology Platform | HCM1520

Wednesday Oct 8 | 2:45 PM – 3:30 PM PDT
